title: FACTBOX-Cricket-10 heaviest test defeats by runs
text: April 3, 2018 / 10:48 AM / Updated 3 hours ago FACTBOX-Cricket-10 heaviest test defeats by runs Reuters Staff 1 Min Read April 3 (Reuters) - List of 10 biggest defeats by runs suffered by a test nation after South Africa beat Australia by 492 runs in the fourth and final test in Johannesburg. England beat Australia by 675 runs at Brisbane (Nov. 1928) Australia beat England by 562 runs at London (Aug. 1934) Australia beat South Africa by 530 runs at Melbourne (Feb. 1911) South Africa beat Australia by 492 runs at Johannesburg (April 2018) Australia beat Pakistan by 491 runs at Perth (Dec. 2004) Sri Lanka beat Bangladesh by 465 runs at Chittagong (Jan. 2009) West Indies beat England by 425 runs at Manchester (July 1976) Australia beat England by 409 runs at London (June 1948) West Indies beat Australia by 408 runs at Adelaide (Jan. 1980) Australia beat England by 405 runs at London (July 2015) (Compiled by Hardik Vyas in Bengaluru; editing by Amlan Chakraborty)
